Package org.forgerock.openam.utils

Class JCECipherProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.utils.JCECipherProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CipherProvider
    public class JCECipherProvider
extends Object
implements CipherProvider
    A CipherProvider that gets queries from the underlying Java Cryptographic Extension (JCE) facilities, via Cipher.getInstance(String, Provider). If the preferred JCE provider is not available, then falls back on any provider that can supply the given transformation.
    Since:
    12.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      JCECipherProvider​(String transformation, String preferredProvider)
      Initialises the cipher provider with the given cipher transformation and preferred provider.
      JCECipherProvider​(String transformation, Provider preferredProvider)
      Initialises the cipher provider with the given cipher transformation and preferred provider.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Cipher getCipher()
      Attempts to get a cipher matching the chosen transformation from the underlying JCE facilities.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JCECipherProvider

        public JCECipherProvider​(String transformation,
                         String preferredProvider)
        Initialises the cipher provider with the given cipher transformation and preferred provider. See Cipher.getInstance(String, String) for details on valid values for these parameters.
        Parameters:
        transformation - the cipher transformation specification. Cannot be null.
        preferredProvider - the preferred crypto provider such as "SunJCE". Will be ignored if null or no such provider exists.

      • JCECipherProvider

        public JCECipherProvider​(String transformation,
                         Provider preferredProvider)
        Initialises the cipher provider with the given cipher transformation and preferred provider. See Cipher.getInstance(String, java.security.Provider) for details on valid values for these parameters.
        Parameters:
        transformation - the cipher transformation specification. Cannot be null.
        preferredProvider - the preferred crypto provider. May be null, in which case it is ignored.

    • Method Detail

      • getCipher

        public Cipher getCipher()
        Attempts to get a cipher matching the chosen transformation from the underlying JCE facilities. If the preferred provider is present, then it will use that provider, otherwise any provider will be used.
        Specified by:
        getCipher in interface CipherProvider
        Returns:
        a cipher matching the configuration parameters, or null if no matching cipher could be obtained from JCE.
